entry.title: some lessons on altering mysql storage engine
entry.content:
Check what storage engine a particular table is using: mysql SELECT table_name, engine FROM INFORMATION_SCHEMA.TABLES;

Changing storage engine of a table; mysql ALTER TABLE `table_name1` ENGINE = MyISAM;

When altering a table engine from InnoDB to MyISAM, you have to delete all constraints on the table otherwise you will get a foreign key constraint error. You can check the constraints within a form using mysql SHOW CREATE TABLE `table_name1`; You can then drop the constraints like: ``mysql ALTER TABLEtable_mame1DROP FOREIGN KEYuser_id_refs_id_1e020b58278eec2b`; ````
